org.contentmine.image.pixel

Class PixelGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.contentmine.image.pixel.PixelGraph

  • public class PixelGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    holds PixelNodes and PixelEdges for pixelIsland a graph may be a number of PixelNodes and PixelEdges. A single cycle will have a single PixelNode located in an arbitrary position
    Author:
    pm286

      • isSingleCycle

        public java.lang.Boolean isSingleCycle()
        analyzes graph as potentially a single cycle. this could be: - a single cyclic edge with no node - a single edge and node (ouroboros) - two nodes with two edges - a chain of edges returning to the start (The last 3 are really all the same).
        Returns:
        true or false (initially set to null)

      • createCyclicSegments

        public void createCyclicSegments(double tolerance)
        used when the graph is a single cycle. ignore very small <=6 rings
        Parameters:
        tolerance -

      • compactCloseNodes

        public void compactCloseNodes(int minLength)
        if multiply connected nodes are "close" condense into a single node. 1 2 $ $ 3$4 $ $ 5 6 has two close nodes (3/4). After condensation the graph is 1 2 $ $ $7$ $ $ 5 6 Note that 3 and 4 have been removed , 7 is new node and paths may share pixels. This is a mess, of course, and may be edited later.

      • getShortEdges

        public PixelEdgeList getShortEdges(int minLength)
        gets short edges (measured by pixel count.
        Parameters:
        minLength - including nodes; must be >= 3
        Returns:

      • tidyEdgePixelLists

        public void tidyEdgePixelLists()
        sometimes the nodes don't correspond with the pixel lists, so add new pixels to lists this is presumably a bug from PixelNuclei which haven't been properly processed

      • mergeNodesCloserThan

        public void mergeNodesCloserThan(double d)

      • mergeNodesCloserThan

        public void mergeNodesCloserThan(double d,
                                 boolean omit1connected)
        merge nodes closer than a given distance. nodes must be already connected by an edge option to omit nodes which are 1-connected exploratory!
        Parameters:
        d -
        omit1connected - if true do not use 1-connected nodea as this trims the branches

      • condenseEdgeAndRemoveOneNode

        public void condenseEdgeAndRemoveOneNode(PixelEdge edge)
        replace node1 by node0 and tidy nodeLists and edgeLists I think this means: N....N0....N1....N is transformed to N.......N0.......N Use with care! I don't know what happens to node1 edges! I think it's for nodes very close together
        Parameters:
        edge -

        Returns:
